scheme_data.schemeName: Alpsankhyak Muslim Parityaqta/Talaqshuda Mahila Sahayata Yojana
scheme_data.shortDescription: {"id": "wzJpzZEBISXYddfJs5kC", "fields": {"beneficiaryState": ["Bihar"], "schemeShortTitle": "AMPTMSY", "level": "State", "nodalMinistryName": null, "schemeCategory": ["Women and Child", "Social welfare & Empowerment"], "schemeName": "Alpsankhyak Muslim Parityaqta/Talaqshuda Mahila Sahayata Yojana", "schemeCloseDate": null, "slug": "amptmsy", "briefDescription": "The objective of this scheme is to strengthen the economic condition of minority Muslim abandoned/divorced women and make them self-dependent by providing financial assistance of \u20b925,000/-.", "age": {"ews": {"gte": 18, "lte": 50}, "sc": {"gte": 18, "lte": 50}, "general": {"gte": 18, "lte": 50}, "obc": {"gte": 18, "lte": 50}, "st": {"gte": 18, "lte": 50}, "female": {"gte": 18, "lte": 50}, "widowed": {"gte": 18, "lte": 50}}, "tags": ["Minority", "Muslim Mahila", "Abandoned Woman", "Divorced Woman", "Financial Assistance"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Alpsankhyak Muslim Parityaqta/Talaqshuda Mahila Sahayata Yojana. It is also known as AMPTMSY. The scheme &quot;Alpsankhyak Muslim Parityakta/Talaqshuda Mahila Sahayata Yojana&quot; has been operated by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Bihar, since the financial year 2006-07. The objective of this scheme is to strengthen the economic condition of minority Muslim abandoned/divorced women and make them self-dependent by providing financial assistance. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Bihar. The implementing agency is Directorate Of Minority Welfare, Government Of Bihar. Additionally, the nodal department is Minority Welfare Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Under this scheme, the state government provides financial assistance of ₹25,000/to minority Muslim abandoned/divorced women to strengthen their economic condition and make them selfreliant.

Note: The grant amount will be directly transferred to the beneficiary’s bank accounts through RTGS/DBT.

Eligibility criteria include: The applicant should be a resident of Bihar.
The applicant should be a Muslim woman from a minority community.
The Muslim woman should fall under one of the following categories:
•	Divorced 
•	Abandoned by her husband for more than 2 years 
•	Husband is completely mentally handicapped 
The applicant&#39;s age should be between 18 and 50 years.
The applicant&#39;s annual family income should be less than ₹4,00,000/.
The woman should not have remarried.
The benefits of this scheme are available only once in a lifetime.
Widow is not eligible for this scheme. The application process is as follows: Step 1: To apply for benefits under this scheme, applicants should visit the office of the District Minority Welfare Officer in their respective district to collect the application form. The application form can also be downloaded from the department&#39;s website.
Step 2: Fill out the application form and attach all required documents.
Step 3: Submit the completed application form, along with all attachments, to the District Minority Welfare Office of your district.
Note 1: For applications and more information, please contact the office of the District Minority Welfare Officer located at the District Headquarters.
Note 2: Advertisements for the application of this scheme will be published in newspapers by the Directorate of Minority Welfare.
Note 3: The District Minority Welfare Officer will ensure the scrutiny of applications and attachments as per the prescribed procedure.
Note 4: The names and addresses of beneficiaries will be published on the departmental website and in a daily Urdu/Hindi newspaper. Beneficiaries will also be informed via SMS. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://state.bihar.gov.in/cache/42/Old%20Notice%20Board/Schemes%20for%20Minorities/pratiyakta_yojna.pdf Scheme Details (Page No. 6): https://bsmfc.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Yojnadarpan.pdf Official Website: https://state.bihar.gov.in/minoritywelfare/SectionInformation.html?editForm&rowId=3403 Tags associated with the scheme include: Abandoned Woman, Divorced Woman, Financial Assistance, Minority, Muslim Mahila.

   1. Proof of age (any one of the following: birth certificate, matriculation or equivalent certificate, voter identity card, passport, or certificate issued by an executive magistrate)
   1. Community certificate

   1. Address proof

   1. Certificate from the District Civil Surgeon in case of the husband&#39;s mental disability
   1. Photocopy of the bank passbook/bank account details
   1. Any additional documents as required

scheme_data.combined_text:
The name of this welfare scheme is Alpsankhyak Muslim Parityaqta/Talaqshuda Mahila Sahayata Yojana. It is also known as AMPTMSY. The scheme &quot;Alpsankhyak Muslim Parityakta/Talaqshuda Mahila Sahayata Yojana&quot; has been operated by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Bihar, since the financial year 2006-07. The objective of this scheme is to strengthen the economic condition of minority Muslim abandoned/divorced women and make them self-dependent by providing financial assistance. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Bihar. The implementing agency is Directorate Of Minority Welfare, Government Of Bihar. Additionally, the nodal department is Minority Welfare Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Under this scheme, the state government provides financial assistance of ₹25,000/to minority Muslim abandoned/divorced women to strengthen their economic condition and make them selfreliant.

Note: The grant amount will be directly transferred to the beneficiary’s bank accounts through RTGS/DBT.

Eligibility criteria include: The applicant should be a resident of Bihar.
The applicant should be a Muslim woman from a minority community.
The Muslim woman should fall under one of the following categories:
•	Divorced 
•	Abandoned by her husband for more than 2 years 
•	Husband is completely mentally handicapped 
The applicant&#39;s age should be between 18 and 50 years.
The applicant&#39;s annual family income should be less than ₹4,00,000/.
The woman should not have remarried.
The benefits of this scheme are available only once in a lifetime.
Widow is not eligible for this scheme. The application process is as follows: Step 1: To apply for benefits under this scheme, applicants should visit the office of the District Minority Welfare Officer in their respective district to collect the application form. The application form can also be downloaded from the department&#39;s website.
Step 2: Fill out the application form and attach all required documents.
Step 3: Submit the completed application form, along with all attachments, to the District Minority Welfare Office of your district.
Note 1: For applications and more information, please contact the office of the District Minority Welfare Officer located at the District Headquarters.
Note 2: Advertisements for the application of this scheme will be published in newspapers by the Directorate of Minority Welfare.
Note 3: The District Minority Welfare Officer will ensure the scrutiny of applications and attachments as per the prescribed procedure.
Note 4: The names and addresses of beneficiaries will be published on the departmental website and in a daily Urdu/Hindi newspaper. Beneficiaries will also be informed via SMS. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://state.bihar.gov.in/cache/42/Old%20Notice%20Board/Schemes%20for%20Minorities/pratiyakta_yojna.pdf Scheme Details (Page No. 6): https://bsmfc.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Yojnadarpan.pdf Official Website: https://state.bihar.gov.in/minoritywelfare/SectionInformation.html?editForm&rowId=3403 Tags associated with the scheme include: Abandoned Woman, Divorced Woman, Financial Assistance, Minority, Muslim Mahila.

sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Alpsankhyak Muslim Parityaqta/Talaqshuda Mahila Sahayata Yojana.
It is also known as AMPTMSY.
The scheme &quot;Alpsankhyak Muslim Parityakta/Talaqshuda Mahila Sahayata Yojana&quot; has been operated by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Bihar, since the financial year 2006-07.
The objective of this scheme is to strengthen the economic condition of minority Muslim abandoned/divorced women and make them self-dependent by providing financial assistance.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Bihar.
The implementing agency is Directorate Of Minority Welfare, Government Of Bihar.
Additionally, the nodal department is Minority Welfare Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Under this scheme, the state government provides financial assistance of ₹25,000/to minority Muslim abandoned/divorced women to strengthen their economic condition and make them selfreliant.
Note: The grant amount will be directly transferred to the beneficiary’s bank accounts through RTGS/DBT.
Eligibility criteria include: The applicant should be a resident of Bihar.
The applicant should be a Muslim woman from a minority community.

The Muslim woman should fall under one of the following categories: • Divorced • Abandoned by her husband for more than 2 years • Husband is completely mentally handicapped The applicant&#39;s age should be between 18 and 50 years.
The applicant&#39;s annual family income should be less than ₹4,00,000/.
The woman should not have remarried.
The benefits of this scheme are available only once in a lifetime.
Widow is not eligible for this scheme.

The application process is as follows: Step 1: To apply for benefits under this scheme, applicants should visit the office of the District Minority Welfare Officer in their respective district to collect the application form.
The application form can also be downloaded from the department&#39;s website.
Step 2: Fill out the application form and attach all required documents.
Step 3: Submit the completed application form, along with all attachments, to the District Minority Welfare Office of your district.
Note 1: For applications and more information, please contact the office of the District Minority Welfare Officer located at the District Headquarters.
Note 2: Advertisements for the application of this scheme will be published in newspapers by the Directorate of Minority Welfare.
Note 3: The District Minority Welfare Officer will ensure the scrutiny of applications and attachments as per the prescribed procedure.
Note 4: The names and addresses of beneficiaries will be published on the departmental website and in a daily Urdu/Hindi newspaper.
Beneficiaries will also be informed via SMS.
For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://state.
bihar.

in/cache/42/Old%20Notice%20Board/Schemes%20for%20Minorities/pratiyakta_yojna.
